In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, reading the **[spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") of force bolt** allows you to learn the **spell of force bolt**.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Effects](#Effects)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [3.1 Attacking monsters](#Attacking_monsters)
  - [3.2 Utility purposes](#Utility_purposes)
  - [3.3 When to avoid force bolt](#When_to_avoid_force_bolt)

- [4 References](#References)

## Generation

[Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") always start with a spellbook of force bolt, and others can be generated randomly in the dungeon.

## Effects

Casting the spell allows you to shoot a force bolt in any direction, the same as a [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking"). If the bolt hits a monster, it does 2d12 damage; monsters may [resist](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") for half damage. Monsters with player-style [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") take no damage.

The force bolt will break any [boulder](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder"), [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue"), [door](/wiki/Door "Door") or [drawbridge](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge") that it hits. It will also break fragile items such as potions. Note that if a monster is killed by a force bolt beam, the monster's inventory will be subjected to the beam.

## Strategy

Force bolt is a great spell for the beginning wizard, both for attacking monsters and for various utility purposes.

### Attacking monsters

As noted above, force bolt deals 2d12 damage. It has a fixed chance of hitting, not affected by the player's [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity") or spell skills; if the roll of a d20 is lower than (10 + monster's AC), the spell hits.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) This makes it unsuitable for use in the late game, when many monsters have low AC. In the early game, however, this is a quite respectable amount of damage compared to the other weapons usually available, and most early-game monsters have high AC.

[Magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") may be more useful for lower AC targets such as [killer bees](/wiki/Killer_bees "Killer bees") early on, and increases in power with the player's level, making it more desirable later on.

### Utility purposes

Force bolt can be used to break down locked doors or hidden doors that you know about, but can't find by searching; this is especially helpful if you have poor [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"). As with [other methods of forcibly opening doors](/wiki/Door#Opening "Door"), care should be taken to avoid smashing doors in [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown") and doors to shops in this manner.

Force bolt can also destroy boulders, which is useful if you need to traverse a blocked corridor; it can also be used to break statues to access their contents. (While a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") can do the same without the [power](/wiki/Power "Power") cost, it is nevertheless fairly heavy.) In combination with the [stone-to-flesh](/wiki/Stone-to-flesh "Stone-to-flesh") spell, the spell can be used to create a ready supply of [meatballs](/wiki/Meatball "Meatball") from broken statues and boulders, which are useful for raising [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet")' [apport](/wiki/Apport "Apport").

### When to avoid force bolt

*Do not attack [nymphs](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph") with force bolt* unless you are desperate. Nymphs like to carry [mirrors](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror"); if you manage to kill a nymph with this spell, the mirror will break, causing a -2 [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") penalty. However, if a nymph has stolen your [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning") or other dangerous objects and you have no other recourse, it's probably better to take the luck penalty and use the spell.

It is a [Bad Idea](/wiki/Bad_Idea "Bad Idea") to use this spell in shops, as it can and will break fragile merchandise (e.g., [crystal plate mail](/wiki/Crystal_plate_mail "Crystal plate mail")), possibly leaving you with a debt you are unable to pay.

Force bolt can pass the first monster it hits, also hitting monsters behind it. Be careful if there are [shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper"), [watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") or pets around!

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 128](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line128 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")

Contents

  • 3 Strategy
